message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the task of building an autonomous message-classifier that filters relevant and trustworthy information from Twitter. It involves collecting and analyzing a large amount of social media data, and using machine learning classifiers to produce trustworthiness scores. This work is highly relevant to the fields of social media analysis, natural language processing, and information retrieval, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.SI, cs.CL, and cs.IR. Additionally, the paper deals with issues of social network analysis and graph theory, which are covered by the sub-category cs.SOC. Finally, the paper also deals with issues of cybersecurity and trustworthiness, which are covered by the sub-category cs.CR.
